Monthly Report
Section 3: Other Declarations
90% Complete
 Section 3 of 5
Do you have any additional changes to declare, including income? 

You can provide more information about any of the questions answered above. If you are not sure if your change is a change in circumstance, include it here.
A “change in circumstance” can include, but is not limited to:
•  family composition — e.g., add or remove a spouse or dependant
•  income — e.g., monthly employment income or lump sum payments (such as ICBC or a settlement)
•  assets
•  temporarily being out of province

Yes
No

Monthly Report
Section 4: Add Supporting Documents
93% Complete
 Section 4 of 5
Adding Supporting Documents to your Monthly Report

Supporting documents must be submitted before the fifth of the month to ensure that your monthly report can be processed.
Income verification documents must include the declared amount and date received. Examples of acceptable documents include:
•  paystubs
•  employer letters
•  cash payment receipts
•  financial records

Supporting Documents

Confirm your Monthly Report

What to expect next?
Review your monthly report below. You will be asked to provide your 4-digit pin (and spouse if applicable) to complete your monthly report submission.
If more information is needed to process your monthly report, the ministry will contact you.

	Monthly Report
Avoid delays, submit by the 5th


The personal information requested on this form is collected by the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction pursuant to sections 26(c) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act for the purpose of administering the Employment and Assistance Act and Employment and Assistance for Persons with Disabilities Act. If you have any questions about the collection, use or disclosure of this information, please contact the Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction at 1-866-866-0800
